TopicTitle: [1.12.5] Bluedog Design Bureau - Stockalike Saturn, Apollo, and more! (v1.13.0 "Забытый" 13/Aug/2023)

Articles.Content:
Ah! That's what I forgot. Yes, Thor + Able / Ablestar is planned. I think Venom was planning on designing the upper stages..?

EDIT: Not that the rockets are asymmetrical, just that I don't particularly care for the look of their SRBs.

Edited November 4, 2015 by CobaltWolf
True. KW/SpaceY has great SRBs. And they should have SRBs similar to the Atlas V.

Mmmm, you're darn right we're making a Thor-Able/ablestar.

As for the Atlas V SRBs, what's wrong with them? Atlas V is my favourite rocket.

Mmmm, you're darn right we're making a Thor-Able/ablestar.

As for the Atlas V SRBs, what's wrong with them? Atlas V is my favourite rocket.

I just don't like the top. Or the bottom.

This was the design I was experimenting with.
I'd say release it. It looks great
Getting real excited. Stream in two hours - I'm going to finish the textures and make the verniers and decouplers. Can anyone else think of something we'd need?
Awesome! Can't wait to get my hands on it

Awesome! Can't wait to get my hands on it

Keep your grubby mitts off of the atlas!

Cobalt, what else besides the verniers and decouplers? I think you may be able to release before the 10th.

http://i.imgur.com/iNuWED6.png

Getting real excited. Stream in two hours - I'm going to finish the textures and make the verniers and decouplers. Can anyone else think of something we'd need?

Erm...

Retro Pack for deorbiting the Mk1 pod?

I usually make one using an empty Oscar B Tank and Three Snub'O'Trons from Ven's stock revamp but it would be nice to have one from the start.

Or a simple launch clamp?

Heck, I just can't wait to fly it...there are only so many Redstones a man can launch

Didn't you read his announcement about Bloeting? That'll come eventually! Hang in there with us!

Yes, short of a miracle there won't be any Mercury parts in the update. I more meant was there anything that would be desperately needed for a 1.875m rocket? I asked because it occurred to me only today that I'd need a decoupler for it.

Oh, on the topic of Redstone, I took five from working on Atlas today to rough out a tank for it. Not going to be in the update, etc, etc but it's happening.

RE: future rockets, me and Venom have been looking into sizing for more rockets. It's looking like:

Redstone - 1.25m

Atlas - 1.875m

Vanguard - .9375m first stage

Able - .625m (Able is also the vanguard second stage) (Able would include a .625m > .9375m fairing base. Build those early sats small )

Ablestar - 1.25m > .9375m > 1.25m

Agena - 1.25m

Thor/Delta - 1.5625m? (half between 1.25m and 1.875m)

Thor/Delta is really stupid to size. It belongs between Redstone and Atlas, but there aren't any size classes there that fit. The plus side is there are other things that work for that size, like the Mercury MOL and some other stuff.
Why not make the Thor/Delta just 1.5? I remember Beale was talking about that size a while ago...

Why not make the Thor/Delta just 1.5? I remember Beale was talking about that size a while ago...

Paging /u/Beale... wait, crap.

I'll ask about it.

Paging /u/Beale... wait, crap.

I'll ask about it.

Paging doctor Bread!

Just curious, though, do you think you may finish this early? (earlier than nov 10)

Didn't you read his announcement about Bloeting? That'll come eventually! Hang in there with us!

I didn't know he meant 1.875 parts

Looking forward to this release nonetheless.

Good stream so far.

KerbalStuff won't publish the update so have a thing. No pics tonight because I just streamed for 7 hours and feel awful. As always report bugs, etc. I rushed it a bit to try and get it released tonight so there are some rough patches in the art.
